column4: I need a file called libstdc++.so.5, but I cannot find it in the standard libstdc++ packages from the repository... does anyone know of a package this comes in?
try using getlib on the file.
!getlib | neeto
I'm with you on that bot
how do I use getlib?
install it with : sudo apt-get install getlibs
ah plural
makes all the difference
then use it against your file in question.... : locate libstdc++.so.5
I don't have the file, I need to get the file.
once you have the path to libstdc++.so.5 ...its getlib /path/to/your/file
what are you trying to run that requires that lib?
N64 emulator
for example if it was vlc....you would do : getlib /usr/bin/vlc
what repo are you getting getlibs from, I am not seeing anything from my repos
apt-cache show getlibs
sorry i must have obtained it from the forums which are currently down
but here is its 'pre deb' incarnation : http://www.boundlesssupremacy.com/Cappy/getlibs/getlibs
im just worried that the ms technique of embrace extend & exclude wont get nastier
debs here : http://www.boundlesssupremacy.com/Cappy/getlibs/
unfortunately getlibs says that all dependencies for the application are met, which, first of all is false, and still leaves me the trouble of getting libstdc++.so.5
have you tried searching packages.ubuntu.com for the file?
not yet, hold on
its a shame the forums are down as i know there are some good threads there about this file
